info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 11:10PM EDT until July 15 at 2:30AM EDT by NWS Mount Holly NJ
info.description:
At 1110 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas.
Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Millville, Laurel Lake, Estell Manor, Port Norris, Bivalve, Mauricetown, Leesburg, Bricksboro, Dividing Creek, Port Elizabeth, Fortesque and Newport.
info.instruction:
Turn around...don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EDT TUESDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN CUMBERLAND COUNTY
